subject: Law
title: Duress and Necessity
description: A fast breakdown of Duress and Necessity for builders.

hook.text: A man robs a pharmacy because a kidnapper threatened to kill his child. Is he guilty?

buildup.text: Duress is a defense when someone commits a crime because of an immediate threat of serious harm from another person.

discovery.text: Necessity is similar but involves choosing the lesser evil: breaking into a cabin to survive a blizzard.

twist.text: Duress is almost never a defense to murder. The law won't excuse killing one person to save another.

climax.text: Both defenses require that the defendant had no reasonable legal alternative and the threat was imminent.

punchline.text: Duress means someone forced you. Necessity means circumstances did.

quiz.question: What distinguishes duress from necessity?
options: Duress involves human threats; necessity involves circumstances
Duress applies only to property crimes
